But even when Rocket opened the grate of the little baby raccoons and they were looking so scared but also went with him because they felt safe.I really liked Groot to and how he is still a badass and damn he got huge!!Nebula got het temper under control a bit more and I loved that she even though she tought they were stupid. Was gonna help a bunch of kids grow up and give them a future.Drax made me laugh a lot I really like his character.I really enjoyed Mantis and her powers, when she made the guard think he was madly in love with Drax. How during the fight she made them dance and how she took the right to her own life back by making her own choices!I'm sorry but Peter was a whiney little prick. Okay I get it you lost the love of your life, but damn man not everything is about you.And that's why I loved the new Gamorra even more.
reviews.heading: Emotional rollercoaster

reviews.content: Watched this one with my friends.This movie is pretty hard to describe.James Gunn is amazing and it shows in this film. The best part is that all of the Guardians' arcs got closed, at least for now.Peter learned that his opportunity with Gamora was one in a million and he just can't get it back. He gets to embrace his Earth roots.Gamora found a family, not with the Guardians, but with the Ravagers. Like the original Gamora, she goes with who finds her first. She also understands that she and Peter were together and isn't just disgusted by it.Nebula gets to soften up.Drax finally understands metaphors and he stops just being a dumb brute.Mantis goes on her own, refusing to take orders from anyone.Rocket, I don't even need to explain it.Groot speaks.That former Ravager learned to control Yondu's arrow, it was amazing and sad to see Mary Poppins back.The High Evolutionary is a horrible villain, in a good way. Never have I wanted to break the spine of a villain so much. Tortured animals and was basically Space (austrian painter). Genuinely horrifying villain. Glad he got what was coming to him.Also the gore was good. The HE's mauled face at the end was incredibly satisfying.Jokes were funny. Curses good. Didn't expect the f-bomb to be in a completely normal moment so it was pretty funny.The best part is that we can now understand our boi Groot. Even OUR arc came to a close. We became honorary Guardians.
reviews.heading: Emotional, subjectivity is important

reviews.content: Unsurprisingly, James Gunn has successfully made Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 a really good movie. It was definitely a more darker approach to the MCU while maintaining a lot of humor in it, and overall Gunn managed to mix the two aspects really well.I will say that if you if you have a soft spot for animals and disturbed by cruelty towards animals (like myself), then you may have a hard time sitting through this movie. The main villain is easily hatable, and similar to Thanos, has a genocide complex (minus the interesting part).Rocket was easily the heart of this movie, and Gunn did an excellent job fleshing put his character. While hard to experience at times, it was sad, dark, and traumatic. This was ended up being the most horrific Marvel movie I have ever seen, and I'm not alone on this stance.The writing was good too. I don't think it was dry like the other more recent Marvel films, so it's really just a breath of fresh air to watch a Marvel movie that makes me care about these characters, and I haven't felt that since Wakanda Forever. The humor is freaky funny at times (especially with Drax), but at others it just fell flat to me (which has to happen at least once in a Marvel movie, but I'm glad the humor wasn't as bad as Love and Thunder). The action was great, and the film has a lot great camera angles that i really appreciate a lot more than most people will.Adam Warlock has always been an interesting character for me. I'm not too familiar with his role in the comics, but I have read a fair amount where he is featured. Warlock just doesn't really have a purpose in the movie, he just causes some chaos, leaves and then 40 minutes later causes more chaos. I get that he was setup from Vol. 2, but he's just so underdeveloped to the point that he probably shouldn't've even been in this movie. I do hope Marvel does more with this character as he definitely didn't serve justice for this movie.While Rocket did steal the show, I felt like every other character in this film was written pretty well. Quill had his moments, and I felt like he was really fleshed out a lot in this film too. The other characters were just as good too, some of them may not be as fleshed out as I hoped them to be, but that's ok as that is made up through their charm.This movie has once again given me hope for the MCU. It was a really emotional movie that had a nice blend of action, darkness, and humor, and you can tell James Gunn really cares about these characters, and I wish him the best of luck for future projects he ends up working on in the future.
reviews.heading: James Gunn Saves the MCU

reviews.content: Thank you, James Gunn, for creating an actual good MCU movie post Spider-Man Far From Home.As much as some jokes were cringe, I can say I managed to handle the weakest jokes. The story was interesting and High Evolutionary was impressive character. I got reminded of Spider-Man Unlimited after seeing Counter-Earth. Visuals were amazing and way better than ones from Quantumania. Spoiler alert: The scene with High Evolutionary missing his face was pretty gruesome and made GOTG 3 more interesting. The epilogue was great.If you feel like Far from Home, most of Phase 4 and Quantumania bored you, you may not regret watching this movie.
reviews.heading: Finally. Another good MCU movie

reviews.content: I love the film overall, a truly amazing send off to the Guardians Series. A brilliant comedy, yet showing the incredibly sad story of Rocket's past. I was disappointed with how Adam Warlock turned out though, as in the comics he is one of the singular most powerful characters in Marvel. Moving on, the soundtrack was fantastic. One of my favourite songs from the film, 'In the Meantime', by Spacehog, has become one of my favourite songs ever. I love that at the end, Rocket becomes leader of the Guardians, Drax becomes a dad again and Groot's first words aside from 'we/I am/ are Groot', saying, 'I love you guys'. Overall, brilliant film, the High Evolutionary was a good villain for the it, and I am 100% positive I cried at least once. The death of Lila, Teeths and Floor was so sad, I really wanted them in another film, but that won't happen now. Like I said earlier, brilliant film, would go and see it again if I could.
reviews.heading: GOTG 3 Review

reviews.content: After enjoying Guardians part 1 and 2 we were looking forward to this and anticipated a similar experience. So much of this movie depicts animal cruelty that my kids (middle school age) were both reduced to tears. I don't have any issues with telling Rocket's story but it would have been nice to have a heads up. The violence was a lot more explicit overall than in the first two movies. We all left a bit traumatized, to be honest.Also, Gamora's storyline was kind of pointless. The scenes she was in just ended up being a frustrating waste of time. I liked her character a lot in the first two movies - this is nothing to do with the actor - the writing for her was just kind of pointless in this one.
reviews.heading: Animal cruelty and gory violence

reviews.content: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is a cinematic masterpiece that breathes new life into the MCU. After a series of underwhelming releases, It was a fresh air of a movie after all the trash that MCU has been given us like LAT, Ant-Man, Wakanda Forever, Eternal, MOM, Black Widow. This film emerges as a refreshing departure, presenting an actual movie experience rather than relying solely on fan service. Most importantly, it was free from cringe-worthy, over-the-top unfunny jokes.From the beginning until the end, with every seconds and every minutes, it was incredible. The film boasts a compelling plot that keeps viewers engaged, thanks in large part to a formidable villain. Additionally, the introduction of Adam Warlock is executed in such a cool way that it become a meme.One of the movie's standout moments comes in the form of an emotionally charged rocket flashback scene. The fact that an MCU film can make such a heartfelt response from audiences is a testament to the exceptional storytelling prowess of director James Gunn. Furthermore, Bradley Cooper's remarkable performance as Rocket deserves special recognition, as he brings depth and authenticity to the character.Each character in the film shines, undergoing significant development that adds layers of complexity to their personalities. Nebula and Rocket, in particular, experiences a noteworthy transformation that showcases the film's commitment to character growth.Another brilliant aspect of this movie is the clever use of the soundtrack enhances the overall fun and immersive nature of the movie.Furthermore, the visual effects are a true marvel, surpassing the shortcomings of previous MCU releases. The CGI is impeccably executed, and the vibrant color contrast beautifully captures the awe-inspiring wonders of the galaxy. Lastly, the movie's breathtaking visuals are complemented by astonishing makeup work cant be overlooked.Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 solidifies its place as the best Marvel trilogy to date, I think it even surpassed the Captain America trilogy. As the final chapter in the Guardians saga, it delivers a poignant and satisfying ending that leaves viewers with a sense of bittersweet melancholy. The realization that we won't see the original Guardians ensemble again is truly sad. This movie is truly a cinematic gem. Director James Gunn's visionary direction, coupled with outstanding performances and remarkable visual effects, creates an unforgettable movie experience. Thank you, James Gunn, for gifting us with this extraordinary trilogy. Totally a 9/10 rating. I love it.
reviews.heading: Finally a good MCU movie

reviews.content: I think James Gunn is among the better of the MCU directors, and a man who truly loves art and embraces its ideology. Art--movies included of course--loves its outcasts. "Star Wars"--arguably the most iconic sci-fi series of all time--was all about rebels fighting against oppressive imperialism. This ideology is picked up further even by blockbuster-oriented projects like the MCU and is at its most visible here, in "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3", at least since Ryan Coogler's 2018 "Black Panther".The movie's villain is known only as The High Evolutionary (Chukwudi Iwuji)--a compulsively obsessed scientist with a God complex driven by nothing other than perfection. He has developed a scientific (well, sci-fi) method of speed-running lifeforms through millions of years of natural evolution in order to create a perfect civilization. I think the authoritarian approach--depicted in such an extreme view--is visible here. Obviously, the movie doesn't get too deep about it. But while it keeps a safe distance from politics, it touches a bit on psychology. The High Evolutionary comes out as an insecure villain, one who is frustrated when one of his creations outsmarts him. Again, the movie doesn't delve deep into these ideas either, as this is not its purpose. Still, the simple fact that they are being touched upon is enough.Probably what you're most interested about is whether this is a proper Marvel movie. Which means: is it funny, is it visually stunning and is it entertaining? The answer to all those questions is yes even if not in equal measure. The comedy still lands most of the time, with each member of the gang filling their role as they should: from Chris Pratt's loveable and dorky Starlord, Pom Klementieff's awkward Mantis and not to mention Dave Bautista's Drax the Destroyer--he is still the whole-hearted big guy we all love. Actors will always improve at their role if they play it long enough. Directors know this, and James Gunn really puts his characters through many interactions, contradictions and heated arguments. The amount of characters the movie tries to juggle can make it unwieldly sometimes, but nonetheless they are all comfortable in the positions they are in. Visually, it's still a treat. Except the Dr. Strange movies, the Guardians series offer the best visual set-pieces and each movie ups the previous one with this one being no exception--that's entertainment.That being said, this is also the most tear-jerking of the three movies--and also among the entire MCU franchise--it revolves around Rocket (Bradley Cooper) and his tragic and disturbing origin story. At the beginning, he is attacked and spends most of the movie on life support. From there, the movie forks into flashbacks describing his creation. While those flashbacks, depicting him in cages recall dark ages in humanity's past they also cheat a bit into getting to you. Here, James Gunn uses the fact that humanity tends to show more empathy towards animals than fellow humans even though we should consider humans more precious--if you saw the movie, you will know what I mean. There is something about the purity and innocence of our less sentient friends that we feel we must defend. It's a cheap shot, but I admit it got to me.But of course it did. This is "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3", the third installment in the Marvel's "Guardians" sub-series so why did it not feel special? It has nothing to do with the movie and I apologize if you find this answer ambiguous. What I mean is that while the first two movies felt like an event, this one feels like just another one in an ever-growing expansion. A drop in the ocean. Maybe it's simply because the MCU has become increasingly big, with more plotlines moving in parallel than ever before. Or maybe, we've gotten used to the experience of Marvel movies after more than a decade of them. Or maybe... it's just me.
reviews.heading: The outcasts rule again

reviews.content: Up to this point, there has been one trilogy in the MCU that has been excellent from start to finish. It's time to add another one to that list. "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3" is a more than fitting conclusion to the narrative of these characters. James Gunn (writer/director) took his time creating connections and depth to each of the individual story-arcs.While recent films in the MCU have felt like "filler episodes" whose purpose is solely to set up a future entry in the franchise, this film stands on its own. The story is isolated, which gives the illusion of finality. In more ways than one, "Guardians 3" is a unique entry in an otherwise convoluted extended film universe.The filmmakers were not afraid to take their time telling this story, which caused the film to drag at times. Though it felt lengthy at 2 hours and 30 minutes, I do not know what they could have cut out. In typical superhero movie fashion, the climactic battle had plenty of explosions to go around.Between the villains and the bickering within the Guardians, there was an excessive amount of yelling in this movie. A headache was imminent, as much of the third act was screaming match after screaming match. While these scenes were emotionally heavy, the yelling distracted a bit from the strong acting."Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3" is one of the better entries in the Marvel Cinematic Universe since "Avengers: Endgame". Though more chaotic than the other two films in the trilogy, it is a beautiful conclusion to the Guardians' story. Boasting stellar set pieces, an excellent soundtrack and perfect chemistry between cast members, this is a film that I am eager to re-watch.Best Character: Drax Best Quote: "She is to us." Best Scene: Infiltrating Orgocorp Best Piece of Score: "I Love You Guys"
reviews.heading: I just got done watching this movie on M4U UHD tonight. 3.5/10!

reviews.content: Today I watched Galaxy Guardian, the third oneReally liked this one honestly, probably my favorite James Gunn superhero flick. It still has the cliche Marvel formula but it takes some creative risks and shows a real James Gunn feel. Its not that the marvel formula is a bad thing, its just that it can be very stale if there isnt an interesting way the formula checkboxes are hit. Luckily, on this one, his imprint is marked all over this thing.For starters, this movie flies by, I didn't even feel the run time in the slightest. Maybe some scenes could have been chopped out, but I wouldn't know which one to choose. Sometimes the film can be a bit confusing, but I feel like thats just because the movie is really chalked full of stuff.Loved the action, some very fun cinematography. There were some VERY fun long takes that looked incredibly well choreographed. Boring soundtrack, kinda exactly what you would expect tbh. It was standard Marvel and standard guardians of the galaxy soundtrack. Radiohead's creep is the most overrated radiohead song.Thought that some of the performances could have been a bit better. Mantis occasionally made me cringe but was overall fine, Chris Pratt kinda the same. There was a scene with Rocket where he was talking at a higher octave and it sounded like an adult trying to imitate a child's voice and it was abhorrent. Usually Bradley Cooper does fine, but honestly he felt like he kinda phoned it in on this one through the whole movie. Cgi was mostly awesome, but there was a scene when they were in space suits that looked oddly gummy. Like their suits were very weirdly stretching around and being funky. Looked like a computerReally why this movie works is the combination of high stakes intensely well made action, coherent story telling and relatively funny jokes. The film also does a good job at tugging at your heartstrings... Pretty tightly I may add. This is definitely the most intense emotional driven Marvel movie since infinity war imo, there are some heart wrenching scenes in this one and seriously great character growth through the film.Overall, even though this is a bit formulated, its my favorite Guardians movie and my favorite Marvel movie since Infinity war. I love the direction James Gunn went here and I'm glad to see him have a bit more creative freedom on this one. A lot of the falling flat here is so menial it barely effects the movie. The formula is still here, but its bended splendidly. Would definitely recommend, also a good dad movie.Mid 7/10.
reviews.heading: TIW guardains of the galaxy 3

reviews.content: I liked the soundtrack, but that's about it. This feels like a music video montage at times, just lots of classic 70's/80's music.One thing I noticed really quick, is that Will Pouter shouldn't be in action movies. I'm sure he worked out for this role but it just doesn't fit in with his body type and his expressions are painful.The comedy wasn't at all like the previous films. This film is for kids and die hard fans only. I made it almost 30 minutes and.realized that this film is 2.5 hours long I bailed.The comedy wasn't at all like the previous films. This film is for kids and die hard fans only. I made it almost 30 minutes and.realized that this film is 2.5 hours long I bailed.
reviews.heading: Strictly for fans

reviews.content: The tight-knit Guardians are each dealing with their own individual challenges: Rocket's got emotionalistical issues, a heartbroken Quinn--er, Quill, still agonizes over Gamora--whose existing version is now a ruthless Ravager lieutenant, Drax is being Drax, so on and so forth, but they have to brush that aside while embarking on a dangerous mission to protect their favorite raccoon. For true followers this serves up the requisite action, the hip music, the irreverence and squabbling, though there are a few too many moral platitudes, plus a negligible villain and extemporaneous subplots, one involving Rocket which is really a missed opportunity. James Gunn, back in the saddle after some widely publicized controversy, doesn't fit all the pieces together perfectly, but he knows his characters well enough to make it a fun watch, and is able to put together an exciting climax even if it's still not as impactful as it could be. **½
reviews.heading: it's not the ideal ending but still has some moments

reviews.content: For the first time, in a long time Marvel delivers a movie that was reminiscent of the MCU pinnacle.Full of emotional/meaningful moments, plenty of GotG action, and their sunset story was brilliant. The humor to emotional ratio was well balanced, and pacing of it all was masterful.After so many recent MCU movies lacking substance or direction, it was so good to see an impactful Marvel movie again.Unfortunately, i don't think GotG 3 is going to do much in the way of getting Marvel back on the right path. It was more of a send off to a beloved franchise that was apart of the MCU in it's prime.But i LOVED this movie.
reviews.heading: For the first time, in a long time...

reviews.content: This is the kind of movie that you don't expect to make you have feelings but here I am, with "all the feels", as the kids say.The way this movie explores so much about every character as they have grown since the first and second movie is very powerful. Rocket's storyline is obviously the most heartfelt and needs to be watched without any spoilers. But there are also moments that come out of nowhere and unexpectedly punch you in the gut without feeling cheap.There is a scene with Drax where he recalls his lost family and it is so casually heartbreaking I almost cried at that alone. And the post credit scene was even enough to make me cry.Just watch this movie already for the love of all things.The costumes, action, story, and music are all fantastic. It's really one of the best things Marvel has ever put out and it's no surprise it comes from James Gunn.
reviews.heading: Epic finale to a great trilogy

reviews.content: Since Stan Lee died I had the feeling that Marvel movies are lacking in quality and mainly originality, but I always liked Quardians of the Galaxy and that's why I decided to give Marvel one last chance but I was left speechless with disappointment.First of all, everything and everyone was so loud! Was it because the dialogues was so plain or because you keep losing interest every five minutes?Secondly, it was too long , but I guess that happens when you aren't entertained . I had enough of it after one hour.Finally and the most important thing of all, what was it with all the mutated animals? By the end , I just had the feeling they are trying too hard to schock us with something. Everything was allowed, doesn't matter if it brings something to the plot or not. You could feel that there were at least 15 writers working on it and everyone wanted to pitch in with something bizarre. Where is the originality? Where is some deeper meaning? If you don't have it , then don't produce it !!Maybe it is time for Marvel to back off and straighten their priorities because right now it just say cash and fans are blindly following. But with which number of Spider-Man will it finally be enough?
reviews.heading: What was that?...

reviews.content: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is undoubtedly the best of the trilogy, with a script that delves into the characters' personalities and backgrounds, especially Rocket (the main character of this film), creating a story that alternates between flashbacks and present events.Strengths: The film has many strong points. The special effects, the acting, and above all, the soundtrack and the plot are remarkable. The soundtrack is amazing, featuring rock songs from the 70s and 80s that play a significant role in all the Guardians of the Galaxy films. But what really stands out is the plot, where unresolved issues from previous films are addressed and new ones are introduced. Each character has a compelling arc, but two of them deserve special mention: Rocket and Star-Lord, whose development is outstanding.Weaknesses: The comedy, though well-done, is rather sparse in this film. However, it doesn't detract from the essence of the Guardians of the Galaxy. Another drawback is the lack of originality, which is mainly evident in the villain who, despite having some innovative ideas at first, ends up being a cliché.Conclusion: This is a great film that can appeal to both Marvel fans and popcorn moviegoers as well as serious cinephiles. This is largely thanks to its superb visuals, its engaging plotline and its stellar performances. It's very enjoyable and I would recommend it to anyone.I rate it 7.7 out of 10.
reviews.heading: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3

reviews.content: Probably one of the best 3rd parts of a trilogy I've seen and definitely one the best superhero ones . Lt's a perfect farewell to the fun bunch that we all love .. I cried a decent amount of tears when we had to say bye to them as a whole , I'm sure we will see them in different movies but not as a team which is sad but it's better to stop while people still care ! The movie has amazing visuals if there is something Guardins movies are the best in are AWESOME looking creatures , AWESOME colors ,AWESOME music and AWESOME jokes and Vol.3 has a lot of everything ! It was very well paced and I was engaged the whole time even though I was sick and felt that 3D even worse still I didn't wanna blink for a second so I don't miss a thing .Before I saw it I actually did read a few articles about the movie and I read that many parents were actually mad because the movie made their kids sad ... and you know what I'M SO GLAD !! And those parents they should be too cause at least they know their kids are not some sickos !THANK YOU JAMES GUNN!! Thank you for sneaking such an important and powerful message in such a popular movie that will be seen by so many even if they " close their eyes " when it comes to this in normal circumstances! I cried a lot. I am a person who cannot stand such stuff and it hurts the deepest parts of my soul seeing something like this . I've chosen to live the way I live because if there is one thing I believe in is equally but I know how many people out there change the subject really fast when it comes to that because deep down they know its not right but it's just easier to do nothing !!! I'm happy kids saw that !! I hope they ask questions after the movie and remember how they felt while seeing these scenes ! I don't see why would someone feel offended when this is the miserable reality and if someone's mind should be changed that's exactly the kids !Will I rewatch- YES DEFINITELY WILL , will it go to my collection- YES definitely will !
reviews.heading: Perfect farewell!!

reviews.content: As a neutral, I felt this movie was fun and entertaining but at times I was left confused where the story was going. It's fair to say though the humour kept it engaging to a point where it was getting a bit repetitive.As for the content, I felt it was ok,the characters played their respective part well. Stallone's introduction didn't really made sense in my opinion. I just felt like it could have been given a bigger part.Overall, I felt the movie was ok - I can see why the reviews were high for this movie. Personally the plot was overpowering but entertaining and fun viewing in certain part.
reviews.heading: Viewable but slightly underwhelming

reviews.content: Marvel hasn't put out a quality movie since avengers endgame. For many people including myself, this was the chance I was going to give marvel before I stopped seeing their movies altogether.GOTG3 brought back all the things that made it a game changer for the MCU. Music, actually good humor that isn't forced, and lots of color. The story was mostly good but the villain left something to be desired. Unlike Thanos, this villain's antics and motivators were weakly supported. There were definitely clunky parts but overall it was a GOOD movie. Be warned, some of it may have you crying in da club.
reviews.heading: A return to form for Marvel. A decent/good ending to the triology

reviews.content: Guardians of the Galaxy was one of the best and most surprising things to come out of the MCU. They were an unknown group with heroes that were even more unknown than Iron Man (at the time). However, thanks to director James Gunn, he made them one of the most popular Marvel characters and team. I loved the first one and it is still up there in one of my favourite Marvel films. The second one is a great movie but not as good as the first one. There is a joke that the 3rd movie is always the worst which did occur with Ant-Man recently. Does Guardians of the Galaxy fall into this or does it deliver an epic trilogy?One of the core themes in the Guardian of the Galaxy movies is family and loss. This is still prevalent here and still as powerful. We see the Guardians feel closer as a family than ever but also argue a lot like family too. In terms of character arcs, Peter is still reeling from the loss of Gamora, Yondu and even his mother which is making him go to the bottles. His struggles stem from self-blame for those losses and becoming more protective of his current family, The Guardians. He has conflicts with alternate Gamora who he still sees as his Gamora which she is having none of. Nebula is also a stand-out character this time with her being a member of the Guardians and not an antagonist. She has great interactions with everyone and her character arc is a great one. The character that is the major focus of GotG3 is Rocket. We finally get his backstory which is so dark and heartbreaking that it genuinely brought a tear to my eye. Mantis and Drax are still the idiot duo but they get some emotional moments and even cool scenes where they shine. Likewise, Groot, Kraglin and talking dog Cosmo are mostly just there but they get moments to shine too.On that note, the return actors continue to do a great job in the role. They all get to flex more of their emotions due to this more emotional entry. Special praise to Bradley Cooper as Rocket who gives a stunning voice performance. Additionally, I must praise Chukwudi Iwuji's performance as the villain High Evolutionary. He gives a full-on narcissistic, zealous and unhinged performance that makes him so hateable. Another standout element from this series is the music and its incorporation of non-mainstream pop songs. James continues to use great songs such as "In the Meantime" by Spacehog and he uses them in great ways that benefit the movie. One difference this time is the use of some more popular songs such as "Creep" by Radiohead and "Dog Days Are Over" by Florence and the Machines. Nevertheless, they are used satisfyingly that I don't mind their use.There are a couple of awesome action scenes. The ones that come to mind are the fight against Adam Warlock where we get to see the guardians struggle against a powerful foe. Moreover, there is a phenomenal one-shot-looking action scene that illustrates all the Guardian's fighting prowess and it was so cool. The costumes and set design are well-designed. I love how creative the world is with the unique-looking planets and different alien species. Most of the aliens are done using prosthetics and they look great! The story itself is quite basic as it is mostly a fetch quest but the emotional payoff to all the characters' arcs is extremely satisfying. We get what feels like a proper ending to the original Guardians team that I wouldn't be angry if this is the last we see of these characters.However, I do have some minor gripes with the movie. Adam Warlock who was teased since Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 2 is finally here but he doesn't feel that meaningful to the plot. He is just there to be a nuisance rather than a significant antagonist. Him having the mindset of a child just makes him slightly lame. One common superhero movie issue is the vague villain powers which are also here. The High Evolutionary seems to be able to use telekinesis or emit giant energy blasts but never seems to do it against the Guardians when he should. Alternate Gamora was one of the biggest challenges as it was a Gamora with none of the character development from the first 2 films. In this film, she comes off as way too cold and aggressive than the Gamora of previous films which makes her not that likeable. Although, you could argue that was the whole point as she isn't the same Gamora, plus she does have her character arc. There is also a weird Nebula and Peter subplot that is hinted at but never amounts to anything.Overall, what an amazing end to the trilogy! With MCU projects lately being kind of subpar, it was great to finally have an entry that delivers. We now have another entry in great MCU trilogies with Captain America, Tom Holland's Spiderman and now Guardians of the Galaxy. I don't know what is going to happen with the Guardians of the Galaxy movies now that James Gunn is done and moving to DC. Nevertheless, I am looking forward to what James does as head of DC and I can't wait to see what new direction the Guardians go in.
reviews.heading: Yes I am crying about a CGI raccoon

reviews.content: Look it wrapped up the guardians and tied things up in a pretty bow.... But ultimately it wasn't really good? Adam Warlock's inclusion was kind of lackluster, definitely played up the dumbhimbo thing and his reasons for existing and doing what he was doing werent really there. A lot of emotion and action to remind us we should be wowed and sad about the disbanding.... But then the guardians end up plowing through a bunch of other experiment victims in a "cool" blaze of glory. Ultimately it just left me thinking that if everyone that was crushed under The High Evolutionary's control or was an experiment got together to wipe his smug ass out, would have made a lot more sense and would have been a lot less destructive to the Guardian's tech and world. 🤷🏻??? Honestly it's just another indicator that marvel has run its course and can't think of better was of including and removing characters.... Too much copy and paste.
reviews.heading: Okay... but not really great.

reviews.content: Thank you guys for those well spent two hours, i wish you can make a new movie every month.We laughed hard and we cried even harder, the story was so touching and hurtful thou, however friendship was all through thick and thin.We laughed like everytime but this time was a mixed feelings sadness and happiness thru the journey of two hours.Please make more guardians of the galaxy movies, and we really wish to see this team back again.Rocket, your story was very worth telling it was so touching to the heart.I cannot wait for more movies of this film really..thanks a lot guys we love u.
reviews.heading: Thank you guys

reviews.content: First time felt like leaving half way during screening of a Marvel movie.Fanbase cannot replace quality content. The storyline was cringe pro-max.Sorry I love animals but not so much to the extent of feeling sentimental for a animal's love story.Everyone was shouting most of the time & it was super annoying.Just random moral lectures throughout the movie. I mean like do u think an avg. Movie goer is complete evil?Cud relate to nothing. Only showing 2 extremes...either ppl r way too nice or just straight up destroyers.No depth in emotions. Some ppl super haughty for absolutely no reason...others r just gullible. Crying one min.... acting cool, laughing next minute.And u call that a post credits scene...i mean why was it even there?Cud have utilised my time better.
reviews.heading: Nope.

reviews.content:
I'm a huge Marvel fan and when the first Guardians movie came out, I felt it was one of the best MCU movies. Unfortunately, they have gotten progressively worse since then. Just shows that the size of the budget doesn't necessarily directly relate to the quality of the film. I felt the story in the third, and supposedly final installment was so disjointed and overly long that I simply didn't like it even though there were some good moments throughout.***SPOILERS***
As they started focusing on Rocket's backstory, I assumed they were going to flesh out all the character's backstories to some degree but instead they solely developed a rather dark backstory for Rocket. Awful depressing for what's generally billed as a comedy.The antagonist in the film, the High Evolutionary starts out very powerful but in the end gets dispatched rather easily. The High Evolutionary's main weapon, Adam Warlock is so powerful he basically decimates the Guardians single-handedly in the opening act but in the end actually turns into a friend of the Guardians?Throughout the film, I got tired of Quill whining about Gamora not remembering him.Although I like previous appearances by Sylvester Stallone, his part in this film was worthless.One bright spot for me was the cameo by Nathan Fillion. Love him and loved his contribution to this film.Overall, I really wanted to love the film but to be honest, I really felt like I was over them by the end. Instead of missing them, I'm left with a rather neutral feeling about whether I care to see them again or not.
reviews.heading: Should've been so much better

reviews.content: I watched this in a theatre yesterday and I've enjoyed the previous movies but by no means am I a devoted fan of Guardians of the Galaxy. I'm just a casual fan that started off interested because of the mcu and I think this series has grown on me. The movies have always been different but entertaining to me and this movie continues that. I was engaged right away and genuinely was interested in the storyline progression of the film. The acting was great, the cinematic experiences were top tier production as expected from the mcu, and the movie had a unique focus to it. I thoroughly enjoyed watching this movie and yes at parts it got a little somber but I think it helped dig a deeper level for the guardians franchise.In all honesty this might be my favorite of all the three movies. I could definitely see myself rewatching this movie and of course could nitpick certian things but to be completely honest I'd kind of be searching for flaws at that point. I never felt disinterested or withdrawn from this movie. It felt like a solid film start to finish that didn't slow down or get boring or get weird like a lot of modern day movies do now. It's a good film!The only criticism I have is for younger viewers parents should understand this was obviously made for mid-teens plus in age and there's more cussing then usual with some more graphic scenes dealing with animals, injuries, etc. But not like anything crazy bad just be educated and make your discretionary decision as parents. In my opinion I probably wouldn't let anyone non-teen come watch it but thats just my opinion. Outside of that nothing really to criticize.9/10 Solid movie that dug deeper and for sure one of the best recent mcu films hand downs.
reviews.heading: Another solid GoG Film!

reviews.content: Cronenberg inspired but not in a good way. This film is so gratuitously violent and the Missouri of how deserves to live and die seems very arbitrary.The script is a huge mess and the villain plays like a captain planet cartoon.I felt really bad for the kids in the audience because this movie is basically a hard R on violencs and gore and animal torture and mutilation. This was nightmare fuel for kids with faces getting ripped off and anyways having their arms pulled off. Very odd choices by James Gunn.Marvel is really losing it these days. They have to cram too much in and have too many characters have something to do. Having said that Cosmo was a good addition. Chris Pratt really phoned it in. He seemed bored.
reviews.heading: Gross off-putting and weird in not good ways

reviews.content: The third volume of the Guardians of the Galaxy franchise focuses on Rocket's origin story, which can be very difficult to watch if you're an animal lover. The theme of the movie is very dark yet balanced with enough humor and heart. The third installment shows how much James Gunn loves the franchise. Gunn earmarked his viewers to understand the monstrosities of being unmade and converted, imposing a story of empathy and heart that only few Marvel movies have accomplished and making every bit of natural humor to lighten its heavy theme. Gunn masterfully explored a new team dynamic.The last great Marvel movie was Spiderman: No Way Home, and after that, everything turned out chaotic and disinteresting. Volume 3 is a perfect send-off for the GOTG franchise, a perfect film to conclude an incredible Marvel trilogy. What I love about this movie is how every character is well-realized. We get to see each character go to emotional places that they haven't gone to before. Every character is well utilized and even the side characters have their time to shine.Chris Pratt, as always, showed charm and humor that is true to his character, which works every time. The chemistry between Nebula, Drax, and Mantis is well delivered; we discovered new things from these characters. Zoe Saldana as the new Gamora was also great and I appreciate how they did not compromise her character. Instead, they demonstrated that the new Gamora was different from the Gamora that we loved. And Rocket is the heart of GOTG Volume 3, everything about Rocket is the core of this film. One subtle thing that I also love is the ending, when Groot said, "I love you guys," this means that, as an audience, we finally understand Groot after all the "I am Groot," this supports how Gamora finally understands Groot in the end. These subtle details make this film a perfect conclusion to the whole franchise.The only problem I have with this film is how wasted Adam Warlock's character is. Adam Warlock was introduced as this strong creature during the first half of the movie, and I even thought that his character will become pivotal to the movie, but they kinda wasted it. Some choices made to his character along the way were neglected, which resulted in his character looking like an immature creature, with no direction or proven power. This is not even Will Poulter's fault; his character was just not given enough recognition when it comes to the script.When Layla said, "You were right, the sky was beautiful," I cried so hard because my dog just died last week, and it gives me assurance how happy he is now that he was in the sky. Despite its dark and heavy theme, it is still a very funny and entertaining movie to watch. Guardians of the Galaxy Vol.3 is, by far, one of the strongest entries in the post-Endgame epoch. Classic MCU film made with a lot of heart that makes the most out of its core characters.
reviews.heading: My 3-year old dog died 4 days before watching this movie, and it's not the best idea.

reviews.content: There's not much to dislike about Guardians of the Galaxy 3. I have a couple of nitpicky, comic book geek issues, but overall the movie was fantastic. A little-bit overly sentimental, but it was the conclusion of the series so that's totally forgivable.One of the most ironic problems with the superhero genre is that the action tends to be boring, even a little bit tedious. We've all seen fight scenes with 2000 CGI people battling, and we've all seen two invincible people punch each other until the writer determines someone won. The Guardians movies have always been good at setting themselves apart in that respect, and this one is no exception. The one hallway shot should have made me roll my eyes, instead I was impressed.Chukwudi Iwuji was great as The High Evolutionary, which was refreshing after they botched Kang in Ant-Man, but would it have killed them to make his face red? One of my biggest issues with the Marvel franchise is they commit about 80% to the comic book look and then randomly abandon it for no good reason. I hope The High Evolutionary comes back, he's a great character, a powerful character, and Iwuji played him well.I personally would have cut maybe 10-15 minutes of sentiment and pop music, otherwise this was an extremely entertaining watch. I look forward to watching it again when it hits streaming.
reviews.heading: Great, though a tad sappy

reviews.content: I've never written a review on here but after watching this movie I feel as if I have to.Absolutely unbelievableJames gunn needs to direct all of the marquee marvel films here on out. The man just knows how to hit on every little crucial detail of the movies he makes.This movie was just so emotional on so many different levels. I haven't cried to a movie like this in a longgggg time. The soundtrack is a 10/10 yet again. Opening the film with the acoustic version of creep was just the perfect choice, and again with dog days are over in that end sequence. They couldn't have picked a better villain for this film with the High Evolutionary, and executed it better with Iwuji. Having rocket die and come back to life with a Harry Potter deathly hallows esque moment was amazing. There's just so many moments throughout the film where I found myself holding my breathe for whatever reason it may be. Can't wait to see what James Gunn does next, and hope the team at marvel continues off the success of this film.
reviews.heading: The Best Marvel Film in Years

reviews.content: The Guardians trilogy has been something special. With the MCU on an overall decline, I figured I could count on this franchise to bring some good Marvel content. Overall, I enjoyed the film, it was funny and the cast was great as always. I did find things like Star-lord's "almost death" scene to be anti-climactic and just felt a little dumb. The film's villain was nothing special or memorable, what I will remember from this film is the cast and the characters. It was not too satisfying an ending for these characters though. Rocket's backstory worked well, Star-lord and Gamora's relationship ultimately amounted to nothing though. Some things worked, some things didn't, but still a fun ride with these guys!
reviews.heading: Underwhelming but fun finale

reviews.content:
It's like get out but with animals. That's all I wanna say but please enjoy this easy low ingredient no bake peanut butter bar recipe below. I don't know if it's good but if you want to give it a go, let me know if this was helpful to you.Ingredients
1 cup creamy peanut butter
3/4 cup honey
3 cups old-fashioned oats
Directions
1. In a small saucepan, combine peanut butter and honey. Cook and stir over medium-low heat until melted and blended. Remove from heat; stir in oats. Spread into a greased 9-in. Square pan; press lightly. Cool to room temperature; cover and chill for 1 hour.That is all. It's like get out but with animals. Thanks.
reviews.heading: It's like get out but with animals

reviews.content: A surprisingly average film, the first two films felt like a lot better put together and innovative in the marvel franchise but now the 'James Gunn' style feels more like cheap parlour tricks mainly focusing around using a soundtrack of famous pop culture classic tracks to hijack the viewers emotions and feeling of nostalgia, to ultimately try and create more meaning for the plot, which is at best a little empty.This can be also seen by his DC suicide squad, which once again pretty much followed the same formula.The acting was good, which is not surprising by the cast, however the dialogue felt more wooden than usual, not so much on delivery but the script felt very much recycled with the same old quips as before leaving the actors no where new to go with their characters.The over aching story what would eventually lead to end game, gave the first two films a real sense of purpose from the off set. It really took a long time for any sense of plot to develop and throughout I was left with the question 'why now?', Why if Rocket was so important to high evolutionary is he only coming for him now? All seems very shoehorned in, which I feel is everything about this film.Shoehorned in plot, shoehorned in pop culture songs to try and give the empty scenes more emphasis and shoehorned dialog.It felt like a very half baked idea, pushed through with a giant budget to make more MCU content, nothing like the first two films which were clearly part of an well thought out over aching plot that gave the stories a real sense of purpose.
reviews.heading: Meh, pretty average film

reviews.content: I'm a big MCU fun but I guess I'm just not into Guardians. I enjoyed them in Infinity War and Endgame but I just can't get into their standalone movies. They're well liked and their movies are popular, but don't expect this movie to bring you around if you're not already into them.All the characters are petty and rude with few redeeming qualities. They constantly bicker and snipe at each other. I know the other Avengers do this a bit too, but their shenanigans always feel like teasing that comes from a place of love and respect. I rarely get the impression that these characters like each other. It's just constant competition and irritation and I never find it endearing.The plot is fine I guess. It makes sense but I didn't really care. The design of these movies never feels right either. It's always bright and weird and rarely cool and interesting. Just a personal aesthetic. The action is always wacky and unpredictable but also feels random and unearned.If you liked previous guardians, you'll probably like this. But I somehow hoped this movie would bring me around and that was very much but the case.
reviews.heading: It was a Guardians movie

reviews.content: James Gunn concludes an enjoyable trilogy with Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3, which sees Chris Pratt's character Peter Quill leading our ragtag group again against new foes led by The High Evolutionary, who has different uses in mind for his most prized experiment: Rocket. Expect old faces and rivalries as we proceed through stunning plot twists blending humour alongside thrilling action scenes but perhaps comparatively less comedic moments than before; all characters have ample opportunity for growth, especially Rocket, whose backstory steals the show. Gunn cleverly honours past films with throwbacks to memorable music, inside jokes, and themes that made these movies resonate with fans.The film's cutting-edge visual effects and beautifully crafted soundtrack complete this satisfying finale experience. Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3 takes audiences on another wild and wacky ride back to space - but does it soar as high as its predecessors? While many enjoyable moments and heartwarming character beats are scattered throughout this movie, its lengthy runtime can sometimes feel like treading water more than swimming forward. Additionally, despite being teased as a formidable foe, the main villain ultimately comes across as forgettable with flimsy motivations that never make sense. Although there are some clever nods to past entries in this cinematic universe present here these references may intimidate newer viewers by relying on their existing knowledge instead of establishing connections organically.And while everything wraps up by the end credits roll, it concludes too easily without enough weight given to certain plot threads. Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3 is a worthwhile addition to the trilogy - but don't expect anything earth-shattering from its adventure beyond our stratosphere.
reviews.heading: A fun but flawed finale

reviews.content: I was SO looking forward to seeing this. Then reading all the rave reviews and high ratings only elevated my expectations. Maybe that was the problem.I loved the ending. The soundtrack, of course(!!), was phenomenal. Cameos and the return of past characters added some fun satisfaction.All of those positives and I *still* stand by my very unpopular opinion...the first hour and forty minutes of Guardians of the Galaxy, Volume 3 were boring as hell. It was so disappointing. I was not the only in the theatre who had a "long blink." The man next to me snored out loud. When his wife gave him a tap, she said, "I'm dozing off, too..."Once into the final 40-45 minutes stretch, however, it's pure galaxy fun! The dog days are over. :-)
reviews.heading: Eeesh

reviews.content: This Guardian's did something that I've not seen from any other Guardian's, it felt lazy both in writing and directing. Sure it had the usual laughs and fun fight scenes, but the heart tugs were all telegraphed and so maudlin, they felt cheap.Adam Warlock was underutilized, especially since that actor can do so much.Growth and Nebula's arm both felt like sonic screwdrivers. Need something done but can be bothered to find an intelligent way to write it in, just use the sonic screwdriver. When Groot grew wings, I decided I was glad this is supposed to be the last Guardian's, because the franchise has officially jumped the shark.
reviews.heading: Felt Lazy

reviews.content: I never have high hopes for sequels but James Gunn masterfully wrapped up this series. Everything from the soundtrack, action sequences and dialogue were spot on. A lot of care was put into making the storyline relevant and to engage the audience. This ensemble was perfect and I doubt if we'll see another this level of chemistry. Just sitting and watching the ending credits was an experience. My DH is not a fan of the Marvel universe but thoroughly enjoyed this film. It was bittersweet knowing that Star Lord, Rocket, Groot, Nebula, Gamora and Dax will be no more. We've already decided to go back for the 3D version!
reviews.heading: Best of the Trilogy

reviews.content:
Weakest of rhe trilogy, no satisfying ending, lame villains and extreme graphic animal torture for almost no reason.The witty banter is on overload and it doesn't land all the time and Let's be real, Adam warlock is barely in this, gamoora and starkord do not end up together, rockets back story is overall uninteresting and all the B backup players end up the hero's for the 'new' guardians at the end. Urgh. Sigh. Awful. Why is the MCU intent on killing off, replacing, gender swapping and B swapping characters?They wonder why movies flop yet look at the set up at the end of this... now to universe consists of back up captain America, she hulk, hulks son, back up guardians, teen iron girl, teen ms marvel, teen girl Hawkeye, baby girl Thor...
I have not enjoyed 1 marvel anything since Loki.Just end these movies before you have Adam driver as reed Richards ....
reviews.heading: Complete trash

reviews.content: The title says it all. The only thing missing was Rocket making hard and passionate sex with Lylla.What a huge difference between this episode and the previous two. Every character was yelling at the others, not one single funny joke, diversity like you wouldn't believe is possible.I just feel cheated. I look at the cast and i can't believe what piece of junk came out.I wanted to leave the theater 20 minutes after the beginning, but i was ashamed to tell my girlfriend, so i stayed to the end. I found out that she also wanted to leave, but she was ashamed of me.This way I learnt, again, that communication is key in a relationship. It would have saved us more than 2 hours of our time.
reviews.heading: What an ABOMINATION!

reviews.content: I went to see "Guardians of the Galaxy 3". It was as good as the online rumors said. Perhaps it is the most successful Marvel movie in the past year (I will miss James Gunn x Marvel, as he will work on DC next).Maybe it's because Gunn kept showing off the furry creatures that I don't understand why I paid money to watch something I knew was just CGI and made me cry repeatedly.Rocket's origin story reminded me of David Benatar's anti-natalism; Rocket's intelligence was created; he had no right to not be created. He had no choice in being created. And most of the pain in his life could be said to be caused by and endured for his creator's decisions. This makes me wonder if happiness in life can only come from the meaningful pain that one has suffered.James Gunn did a great job of portraying empathy. Well, goodbye, Marvel; looking forward to DC.
reviews.heading: Moved by a Furry CGI Animal

reviews.content: Very disappointing, for me. The weakest movie of the three Guardians Of the Galaxy movies, in my opinion. Too dark and unpleasant in parts, without emotional or intellectual payoff, and too weird in other parts, without charm or wit that characterized the previous two films. Too many explosions and too much shouting. Too loud in general. The only element of this movie that I really enjoyed was the soundtrack. Several good, classic songs. Also: the requirement of at least 600 characters is idiotic. The requirement of at least 600 characters is idiotic. The requirement of at least 600 characters is idiotic.
reviews.heading: The weakest part of the trilogy.

reviews.content: I had high hopes and lucky these were achieved. This movie had a good amount of jokes and laugh scenes. Storyline was better then volume 2. The golden boy was maybe not that great but did also not really mind his presence. Some more music time in comparison with the last two titles wich was nice. All the caracters were good written and had their moments of fame. Even the surrounding characters had a good positive vibe to the movie. I hope Marvel will look to new kind of movies with the same humor level. I am a little worried that one character alone with a own movie will not be strong enough to carry a movie but maybe who knows.
reviews.heading: Classic Guardian of the Galaxy

reviews.content:
I think most of us have been pretty disappointed with marvel's
trajectory and latest few years with a couple exceptions. I've been basically done seeing any marvel movie in theaters and just waiting to watch on Disney+.GOTG 3 is my fave marvel movie and the only one that made me cry throughout it. This is somehow the most emotional marvel movie while still balancing classic GOTG humor. An EXCELLENT villain. Visually a treat. Soundtrack of course is great and ending with Dog days are over was such a good choice. I went in thinking I was going to be entertained, but it was so much more.It's incredibly impressive how dark this one gets. The stakes feel real again. You care about the characters and what happens. It truly is refreshing. Captain America the winter soldier used to be #1, but GOTG 3 has now taken that spot for me.
reviews.heading: My new fave marvel movie

reviews.content: MARVEL IS FALLING APART. Guardians of the galaxy 3 SUCKED. So many plot holes, maybe on par with ant man ( which sucked too ). Movie wise, there are it's moments, but most of the movie doesn't even feel like guardians of the galaxy. You never really feel a tenseness in regards to the plot. Missed opportunity with real character development. All character changes just feel forced and thrown onto you, like you have to accept who they are now without agreeing with why they are that way. It feels like the characters are just put into the events and come out different, but you never see emotional development in voice, word and thought. Just a bunch of upset space teens in a terribly written script. Destroyed Peter in love and thunder and made him even WORSE HERE. The reviews saying this is the best marvel movie of 2023, your bar and expectations must be so low, because true marvel fans know this is A FLOP. This got RATED HIGHER THAN THE FIRST ONE!!! This was miles off from the first one. Should be a 4/10 on a good day, but in comparison to Marvel pre end game, this is a 2/10. Only reason it gets that high is the occasional laugh. Missed the mark marvel, as per usual now. Can't wait to see how garbage "the marvelz" is too.
reviews.heading: Reviews are so off

reviews.content: A journey of laughter, tears, and inspiration. In my personal opinion, it is the best movie since Endgame. The actors and actresses did a great job to tell a touching story about friendship, standing up for what you believe in, and much more beyond.It inspires you to think about life, death, who you are, and what really matters. It brings comfort and strength. During the difficult times that we are living in, we need faith to not get lost and a state of mind believing that there is a way out of the unfortunate situations.If you feel you are trapped or almost lose hope of seeing goodness in daily life, this movie helps you find light.Thanks for being there, Marvel.
reviews.heading: Flashlight in the Dark

reviews.content:
The GOOD
Creep. That's the first song you hear in GOG vol. 3 and it is a fitting song for a group of characters that embraces weirdness, silliness and pure leaded rollercoaster fun. James Gunn perfected the summer comic-book formula and stuck to it. The tone is darker, which is unavoidable given that the origin story present focuses on animal experimentation, but it gives weight to the movie, which has been lacking in the MCU.The general opinion I heard was that this was the best MCU entry in a long time, because it was so fun to watch. The humor, the music, the over-the-top characters and settings. Is not a cinematic masterpiece but is a solid MCU film and definitely worth it if you are a fan of James Gunn style and the GOG characters in particular.In comparing the 3 volumes, I would say the 2nd is definitely the slowest paced and the least fun. I found 3 to not be that behind from no 1, perhaps the first being better just for its freshness and less worn-out humor. I found the villain in 3 to be better. The performance is over-the-top and pure evil with a solid motivation, lacking just a touch of depth. I don't remember the villain from nº1 at all.THE BAD
Some elements are wasted, though, such as Adam Warlock and the sovereigns, which are used just as a segway for the main plot to unfold. Also, Contra-earth gets a lot of screen-time with the bat-characters, supposedly to give weight to its destruction, but lacks depth, since these characters didn't talk at all. I didn't care at all about contra-earth, it was just a filler for the villain evilness. Other characters that could been fleshed out were the villain's supporters, the betrayal in the end felt adequate, but quite hollow as well.CONTROVERSIES?I can't imagine being able to find any controversy in a silly summer film, but since it's 2023, everything is political now. Animal experimentation seems to me to be the only theme that can rustle some feathers, but I felt the way the film presented it was correct, focusing on the characters' emotions. We never hear any character commenting on the particularities of the hard topics other than "he is just evil". The topic is not the focus, just a connection between the protagonist and the antagonist.THE CONCLUSION
A fun, silly and entertaining final(?) entry in the Guardians saga that's definitely worth a return to the cinema, if you have been away from MCU for some time.I reckon that fans of the Guardians (not counting trolls) that didn't enjoy particularly this entry is because they don't like Rocket that much, and the humor/formula is getting old to them.Grade Solid 8, perhaps 8,5.
reviews.heading: TLDR: Solid MCU film, darker, with some filler characters but fun to watch.

reviews.content: Hopeful movie in the last unfortunate MCU. I enjoyed this movie satisfactorily. The movie can be summarized as struggling to save the injured Rocket Raccoon. Members of the Guardians of the Galaxy learn about the Rocket's past in the process. The Rocket was originally Earth's raccoon, which was tested by High Evolutionary. Rocket suffered from animal testing, and how terrible it was for Guardians who watched the surgery to the end, and Nebula said that Nebula was even more terrible than him. Not only Rocket but also various animals have been tested, and their appearance is hideous. It seems to have clearly conveyed a negative image of animal testing with a High Evolutionary that ignores animal ecology and incredibly belittles life. This atrocity of High Evolutionary is deeply related to eugenics. The High-Evolutionary that is hard on eugenics makes us once again wary of eugenics It clearly conveyed the theme of the film by clearly conveying a negative view of eugenics and animal testing. The clarity of the subject matter of the film. Next, the movie ended well with the final installment of the series. Groot's I Love Guys. Means that I can understand Groot's words even for me who have been with me for a long journey. It seems that Rocket became the leader, but each person had the best ending. However, what is regrettable is Adam Warlock, but I don't remember much because Adam Warlock is in such an ambiguous position.
reviews.heading: The Best Ending of Guardians of the Galaxy

reviews.content: This. I've needed this. No doubt a portion of the jokes are all in all too senseless and the tone is a piece befuddling on occasion. Yet, the final product for me is likely the most genuine profound response from me to a comic book film since Final stage. It's anything but an ideal film, I'm clashed with how the managed Adam Warlock. What's more, the principal reprobate is somewhat hammy. However, the individual connection between the watchmen and where they take them is dim, unfortunate, and furthermore gorgeous. This is likewise the best execution from Chris Pratt presumably his whole time playing this person. In any case, the individual who gets everyone's attention is Rocket. I don't have the foggiest idea how yet they need to change the principles degree voice acting exhibitions can be assigned for Oscars since it was mind blowing. This is the most sincerely fulfilling experience I've had with the MCU in seemingly forever. What's more, every pundit who is saying that the film is excessively schmaltzy or sappy... doesn't have the foggiest idea about how much these characters mean to individuals as well as James Gunn. This isn't simply a last part of a story, it's a farewell to a bunch of characters and movies that changed the scene of not just the tone and energy of superhuman motion pictures yet additionally changed the way that bizarre obscure characters who have weird stories can be featured in these movies.
reviews.heading: Most recommended Movie

reviews.content: This movie alone makes me confident in the future of DC now Gunn is heading it and he probably hasnt even reached his peak. This movie shows how well (most of the time for me) how he mixes deep soul crushing sadness with silly humor both aspects he uses to show how human (or animal) the characters are. Rockets backstory alone makes this an amazing movie but I also enjoy how every other character reaches theyre max potential. Peter finally kind of gets over Gamora but still has a possible future with her, Nebula found a family, Drax just embraces his goofiness now, Groot is.....Groot idk about him and Mantis just wants to spread joy where she goes.Then there's the villain, he's really good. There's nothing much for compelling motive, he just wants a perfect world that he can rule but with how evil he's shown to be you just fear him. The warlock is cool, i guess but the High evolutionary is just so damn good villain for Rocket and the guardians.
reviews.heading: A perfect finale for the guardians

reviews.content: We know what to expect, so why am I completely blown away by G3? Because this is a cast and crew that don't constrain or accept boundaries, everything is in the mix. This mixture of amazing scripting, storylines, acting, comedic timing, SFX and most of all dedication and a fascination and imagination that is unrivalled in the Marvel Universe (for me). GotG has the most consistent of all the franchises. Thor started strong; Cap A & T Stark are gone.But this is pure Marvel, brilliant, and it is down to the helmsman and writer, James Gunn. To say he is a MARVEL is an understatement. Our characters have never seemed more real, and the Rocket 'Raccoon' backstory was a genuinely eye opening, tragic and heart wrenching story. It spoke to me on so many levels, most of all, it showed how strong Rocket is, and why he is, and what he's overcome.Some familiar faces brought smiles and some new ones brought tears. The absolute perfection and reality of this 'galaxy' is always an overwhelming roller coaster. MORE PLEASE!
reviews.heading: Spectacular James Gunn & Co Masterpiece

reviews.content: Where do I even begin? This was by far the best assembled MCU ever. I'll start with James Gunn. The man is an artist. A genius. A movie making legend. The use of sound and camera angles took this movie to another level! The fight scene in the corridor was epic!!! Next, Chris Pratt. He delivered one of the most heartbreaking moments when Peter thought Rocket was dead. You could feel the pain. It shook me to the core because it was some of the best acting I've seen in any movie in a long time. Then there's Nebula. Her arc was been so incredible to watch. From an enemy and cold blooded killer to a friend, mother figure, leader, emotionally open person.... It was another artful example of James Gunn. Drax, the Father! All I will say. Lastly.... Rocket. Of all the characters in the MCU I never knew HE would be the one I'd love beyond measure. His backstory will tear you down the core of your soul. I am literally tearing up now just thinking about it. The word "Hurts" will become a trigger word for the rest of my life. Rocket "the Raccoon" has become the true symbol of Marvel. But seriously, be prepared. It's not your everyday Marvel flick. It will take you on a ride you weren't expecting and leave you almost conflicted. Happy but drained. It has definitely jumped to the best in my opinion.
reviews.heading: Bring tissues. Like a box of them.

reviews.content: To say it upfront, I'm not the biggest MCU Fan but that's the reason why I loved this movie or in general the trilogy so much. It doesn't feel like the MCU. Some things can be difficult to understand without the MCU knowledge but in general could the trilogy be outside of the MCU, so definitely a recommendation for aswell non-MCU Fans.Some pros for the movie: It's hilarious - I've never laughed so much in a movie like in this one. Overall I really like the humor in these movies. Another thing what works really well is how the action scenes are choreographed. It's stunning to watch. Another thing the movie makes completely right is the way how it staged to bring this dramatic and sadish flavour to the movie.On the contra side aren't that much things to mention except for one story arc you will see. Without spoiler I think it's way too easy written. Like in a child movie where everything works just out. But to be honest is that all I can complain about actually.So I will definitely recommend the movie to everyone who likes science fiction. Even if you don't like the MCU (like me) it's amazing to watch such a movie.
reviews.heading: I love the independence

reviews.content: This movie carefully blends every element you would look for at the finale of a trilogy (plus the Christmas special). This movie also fills a void that Marvel fans have been longing for. That is a movie where you become attached to the characters and become immersed in their stories. You feel like you can connect with them and are desperately hoping for their final outcome to be a good one.This movie is not only a farewell, but it gives us yet another great adventure with the perfect mix of comedy and seriousness blended together with a soundtrack that is fitting and absolutely spot on. This alone would be enough, but it goes even further to deliver us the background story of Rocket. It also manages to bounce between Rockets story and the present adventure seamlessly. If Rockets story doesn't put you in the feels then I don't know what will. It certainly will be difficult for some viewers to watch as James Gunn isn't one to hold back when trying to hammer home a point and Rocket's story is no exception. Some scenes are incredibly difficult to watch due to the cruelty displayed, but it is Gunn's way of acknowledging harsh realities and how brutal and tyrannical the High Evolutionary truly is.In my view the High Evolutionary was a much more compelling villain than even Kang in Quantumania who is tagged to be the Big Bad. The High Evolutionary's appeal as a villain is a combination of a significantly better script and an absolutely fantastic performance from Chukwudi Iwuji. The rest of the Guardians also play their roles beautifully and are casted perfectly. Each of them is also provided the correct amount of screen time to tell their story as well.I hope the other Marvel directors take note of Gunn's success as he departs for the DCU. Every Guardians of the Galaxy film has managed to develop its characters while telling a story, something sorely lacking in other recent Marvel films.For me this is the best Marvel movie since Infinity War (which I have pegged above Endgame).Enjoy this film as we may not get another Marvel movie of this quality for quite some time.
reviews.heading: The Perfect Send Off for the Big Gunn

reviews.content: It really teeters on 'too stupid' and 'stupid enough to be funny and charming' for me.I thought the first guardians of the galaxy movie was so awesome, because they took the most ridiculous concept (talking raccoon, teams up with alien, tree thing, and a guy) and embraced the ridiculousness. The film didnt take itself too seriously. It knew it was dumb and goofy. I found most of the jokes to be about the absurdity of the nature of the film.By the third film, i think James Gunn is all too comfortable with the seriously ridiculous concept of a talking raccoon, tree, alien, man team. The ridiculousness of the whole thing isn't as embraced, instead jokes are forced out of two dimensional characters. It comes off as very cringe.This movie has some pretty funny parts, and its highly engaging from start to finish, it is even surprisingly emotional... But it is so stupid. Almost too stupid to be charming.Please stop this marvel train while we still can!
reviews.heading: Charmingly Stupid?

reviews.content: This movie was a blast and for me messed with all of my emotions, sad, happy, mad, concerned, etc... Its to bad that this is the last of these Guardians being together but it ended on a good note. Now Guardians of the Galaxy is still the best film in my opinion Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3 is second and Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 2 is third for me. Now the soundtrack is good not the best soundtrack of the three movies but the songs worked for the scenes they were in. I was also happy to see Cosmo join the Guardians of the Galaxy. Anyways this movie is a good flick so go watch it you won't be disappointed. (Unless your Souless).
reviews.heading: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3

reviews.content: Saw this in IMAX and highly recommend it! I'm glad I convinced my mom to see this wild ride with me, (we saw the first two together) and she cried towards the end mainly cause she was moved by the great soundtrack, and she also said afterward it's the most action-packed movie she's ever seen; true it does have a LOT of action. This was magnificent and fun entertainment throughout. I wanted to see it when it first was released, and we finally went tonight (even though I had only around 4 hours of sleep) yet Guardians Volume 3 still hit the spot! I love this gem of trilogies James Gunn has so well crafted together! With a genius soundtrack, packed with great comedic moments, great acting, and emotions that hit all the feels and deserve awards - overall a very satisfying action flick!
reviews.heading: One of the most satisfying IMAX experiences ever!

reviews.content:
The reason Guardians of the galaxy is the BEST trilogy EVER is it has absolutely NO down time never 1 moment where you are bored or dies your mind wander I am bipolar and have ATD and not once watching all 3 in same day did I not stay completely focused on the film. ALL 3 grab ahold and don't let go . It's the PERFECT combination of humor action PHENOMENAL SCIFI AND SPECIAL EFFECTS and story that my friends makes this
what we call a FLAWLESS MASTERPIECE OF FILMS. I love LOTR and we are also HUGE 3d fans TRUE movie BUFFS know it's by far the best way to EXPERIENCE a film. BOTH JAMES know this and do a PHENOMENAL job in giving us a TRUE 3d experience mr Cameron and NOW my Gunn. I just pray to the MOVIE gods he does for DC what he did for marvel. He's created his own legacy now so we're expecting GREAT things. HUGE loss for Marvel actually Disney but a major SCORE for DC. THANK YOU TO THE WHOLE CAST AND CREW EVERYONE INVOLVED YOU created a MASTERPIECE!!! Excuse me MASTERPIECES!!!
reviews.heading: It's official now Guardians is the BEST TRILOGY EVER!! Sorry LOTR and star wars! PHENOMENAL!!!

reviews.content: I don't usually write reviews, but I really felt compelled to after watching this movie. For the first time in a long time watching Marvel movies, I actually felt something while watching, in addition to obvious action scenes with top notch CGI as usual (excluding a few really bad makings, yes I'm looking at you Love and thunder).This movie made me feel sad, happy and angry at the same time, which is rare with Marvel, but I think they realized they had to focus more on the characters and story for people to still love their show.I want to make a review without spoilers, so I'm not going to write about any details about what could've been done in other ways. You can pick on small things which people often do, but I'm rating the movie as a whole, and as an experience for 20$. It's a 10/10 for me!Basically yes I would recommend:)
reviews.heading: Best Marvel movie in a long time

reviews.content: James Gunn has always loved all these characters. The way he has realised every one of these characters is just very admirable. And that's how he's able to make an emotional script with these characters. This can be said again for the 3rd movie. Once again all these characters are very well realised, and there's just something funny, adorable and family-like about their interactions. But I don't like how the second half concluded this movie.The visual effects are brilliant once again, and it feels a lot more cleaner and colorful this time around. The soundtrack is different in this movie from the previous ones. And that's because the tone too is a lot more serious and emotional this time around.But my favourite part about this movie was how these characters interacted. Most of the time they just argued with each other and that's what made their bonds so precious and genuine. I loved how Nebula's and Mantis' characters were realised.And I love how James Gunn handled the character of Rocket. I know he gets a lot of the spotlight in this movie, but even in the previous movies, James Gunn used to build his character up in a very subtle way. As if it was all leading up to this moment.I did say though that I didn't like how they wrapped up the movie.I think a lot of potential was wasted, which is why I wasn't that impacted with how this movie concluded. I personally would have loved for this story to be split up into 2 parts. I would've loved to see so many things explored in depth. Because there's a lot going on in this movie. Along with handling all these characters individually, this movie also tries to build many conflicts and bonds between them, while trying to fit in some new characters at the same time. So after setting up everything brilliantly in the first half. The second half just wraps up those plotlines, just like that. And it just didn't have that impact on me even if it was directed brilliantly.Overall I think it's a good movie but I would have loved to see 2 parts of it. I think it's on par with volume 2, but I still love the first more.
reviews.heading: Would've liked 2 parts

reviews.content: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3 spoiler free reviewVol 3 is James Gunn's final film in the Guardians saga.
